data.title: Luogosanto, Sardinia, Italy
data.text:
Luogosanto is a small town in the Gallura region of Sardinia, Italy. It is located at an altitude of 300 meters (984 feet) above sea level and has a population of around 1,800 people. The town is known for its beautiful scenery, its rich history, and its many cultural attractions. The climate is mild and temperate, with an average temperature of 15 degrees Celsius (59 degrees Fahrenheit) throughout the year. The town has a long and rich history, dating back to the Bronze Age. It was once an important center of the Nuragic civilization, and later became a part of the Roman Empire. The town is home to a number of historical sites, including the Nuraghe Luogosanto, a well-preserved Nuragic fortress.
